[size=2]The fourth mod in a series that attempts to revitalize the combat experience in Skyrim.
Using SkySA as a base, it's now possible to approach a combat experience
more similar to a third person ARPG than ever before.[/size]


[size=4]In SKYRIM.ini - fInitialPowerAttackDelay=0.15
[/size]if it doesn't exist, add it under [CONTROLS]

[/url]2) Download this mod, it should load after SkySA
3) Run nemesis, make sure SkySA is ticked, and generate
behavior (update engine if it asks you to)

author: Dunevar
description:
NOTA BENE:
Questa traduzione [b][u]necessita[/u][/b] del file originale che trovate [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/16676?tab=description]qui[/url]. Ricordate di lasciare un endorse all'autore della mod.

Ci sono delle mod che vorreste vedere tradotte? Visitate la pagina dell'[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/25247]Ordine della Runa Dorata[/url] e vedremo se potremo aiutarvi.

[center][b]DESCRIZIONE[/b][/center]
Lustmord Vampire Armor è una mod che aggiunge una nuova armatura nel mondo di Skyrim. Un'armatura con una triste storia alle spalle, un tempo posseduta da un vampiro. Ora sta a voi forgiarla e indossarla per riportarla agli antichi splendori.

Sebbene sia stata creata per i vampiri, possono indossarla anche i mortali. Noterete poi che l'armatura stessa ha delle proprietà "vampiriche", poiché ha bisogno delle pozioni di sangue per essere migliorata.


Se siete soddisfatti del mio lavoro, vi prego di lasciare un endorse! Traduco le mod nel mio tempo libero (gratuitamente) e mi piacerebbe molto ricevere almeno un piccolo segno di apprezzamento. Fatemi poi sapere se trovate degli errori.

[center]BUON DIVERTIMENTO!
[/center]
name: Lustmord Vampire Armor - SSE CBBE BodySlide (with Physics) - TRADUZIONE ITALIANA
summary: Traduzione italiana della mod Lustmord Vampire Armor - SSE CBBE BodySlide (with Physics).

summary: This is a female imperial high poly preset for racemenu.

author: MagpieScholar
description:
So, you've got your eye on Revyn Sadri, and you want him as the father of your adopted children.  But you're not quite to the point of furnishing a magnificent manor yet, and all Revyn's got to share with you is a single bed, a cookpot, and ... a weird junkroom full of furniture that isn't usable?  Huh.  Seems uncharacteristic for a guy who puts so much effort into his shop and appearance.  Maybe he's waiting for the right person to come along and help him rearrange the place!

This mod adds a small, asset-free home to the Grey Quarter.  It has its own entrance, but there's also a door into Sadri's Used Wares.  Three narrow stories makes for a tight fit, but you, your spouse, and your four favorite orphans can cook, bake, dine, sleep, store your stuff, and become the newest residents of Windhelm's finer slum!

It's a lower-class home, but Revyn has done his best to brighten it up with bits and pieces he's gotten through trading.  Not all the furniture matches, but it's well-lit and cozy.  He hopes that you and up to 4 of your scrawny human potato children will be very happy there.  One of your followers can move into his room on the other side of the shop, too!

And if you're marrying someone else, well, Revyn is probably willing to rent you the Sadri house in exchange for a promise that you'll continue to barter your finds with him first.  Perhaps he'll even hire your spouse as a shop assistant.  You'll never see them go to work, but hey, 100 gold a day is nothing to sneeze at!

[b]How it works: [/b]I dropped a teleport door into the existing storeroom doorway, leaving what's behind it untouched except for moving a strongbox that needed to be accessible for a Thieves' Guild quest.  (Hopefully this will help with compatibility!)  The door takes you into a copy of the storeroom that's been neatened, brightened, and given access to the floors above, arranging the existing furniture into a tight but functional space.  It's been tested for functionality with Hearthfire Multiple Adoption ... though try as I might, I could only fit four child beds in!  It *might* work to move in 6 kiddos and just have them sleep in shifts, but I wouldn't recommend it in those narrow hallways.  The space has been set up with appropriate navmeshes and sandboxing markers.  (I am actually rather proud of how smoothly NPCs handle those stairs.)

[b]Features:[/b]
[list]
[*]Cookpot and Hearthfire oven
[*]4 child beds with their own small chests
[*]Bookshelves for up to 90 books
[*]2 wardrobes, a dresser, a strongbox, and a couple urns' worth of safe storage
[/list]
[b]Known bugs:[/b]
[list]
[*]An extremely enthusiastic child will occasionally clip slightly through the stairway wall when attacking the training dummy.  If I moved it any further into the room, it looked like it was a looming scarecrow coming to eat the unlucky child in the front bed, so I sort of compromised on that.
[*]If you squint upwards from the front door, you can kinda see that the exterior is 2 and a half stories, and the interior is 3.
[/list]
It's minimal, and you'll have to walk over to the market for non-food crafting stations ... but hey, you're just a humble Dragonborn trying to get along in Skyrim's snowiest city.  A warm bed and a place to drop your crap?  Huzzah!
name: I Love Revyn - Multi-Adoption Grey Quarter starter home
summary: Turns the junk room off Sadri's Used Wares into the Sadri House, a tiny family home for player, spouse, and up to 4 children.
